page.title: 12HEALTH/SAFETY ON SEAL SANDS
page.content: All companies on Sealands have their own fire services but are all linked together and to the County Fire Brigade. {(However, 99% of fires are {put out before the fire brigade {arrives!)} The fire services on each site have two men working per shift who are full-time firemen and they are backed up by other members of the plant, e.g. laboratory personell. They are also members of the Seal Sands Toxic Fire Release Plan, which means that they must notify each other if there are any toxic gas leakages so that evacuation measures can be taken. Fire-fighting training takes place on all sites and the length of training depends on the job. Every employee is trained in First Aid but the emergency services are shared and they all have close links with the local hospital.
